headline: US still needs a 'strong manufacturing base': Bill Ford
summary: US automaker Ford (F) is coming out swinging with big reveals at the Detroit Auto Show, including the company's partnership with the Oracle Red Bull Racing team. Senior Autos Reporter Pras Subramanian is joined by Ford executive chairman Bill Ford to talk more about the company's domestic manufacturing, electric vehicles, and the future of its Formula One racing partnerships. Ford is the great-grandson of the American auto company's founder Henry Ford and has previously served as chief executive of Ford. Also be sure to catch Yahoo Finance's most recent interview with Ford CEO Jim Farley and hear Carhartt CEO Linda Hubbard talk more about the workwear brand's partnership with the car company. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.

headline: Oracle's Modern Market Masterclass: What ORCL Can Teach Us All About Today's Market
summary: Oracle's story, particularly over the past two years, should be a lesson to us all about how the stock market now works. Let's take a look at how.

headline: Amazon vs. Oracle: Which Cloud Computing Stock is the Better Buy Now?
summary: AMZN's AWS is reaccelerating with 20% growth, a $200 billion backlog, and massive AI investments as it pulls ahead of ORCL in cloud scale.

headline: Scenic City’s New Jailhouse Studios Planned as World’s First Quantum-Ready Sovereign Data, Processing, and AI Center and Creator Campus
summary: CHATTANOOGA, Tenn., January 16, 2026--Years of exploration and collaboration among real estate, technology, and entertainment industry leaders have led to the official creation of Jailhouse Studios, an entity that is expected to call Hamilton County’s former downtown jail home to the world’s first quantum-ready sovereign data, processing, and AI center and creator campus.

headline: Hollywood billionaire’s battle royale over Warner Bros comes to Britain
summary: The billionaire boss of Paramount has held talks with the Culture Secretary to lobby against Netflix’s $83bn (£62bn) takeover of Warner Bros.

headline: OpenAI Is Going on a Massive Spending Spree. These Stocks Stand to Benefit.
summary: OpenAI is expected to spend nearly half a trillion dollars by 2030, according to analysts at New Street Research, as it looks to extend the lead of its ChatGPT chatbot in an increasingly competitive market for consumer artificial intelligence.  Spending could rise to an annual rate of $100 billion by 2028, New Street’s Dan Salmon and Max Spaeth said in a note published late Thursday, and sustain that pace into the end of the decade.

headline: Latest News In Cloud AI - Multimodal AI Growth: Transforming Markets and Driving Innovation
summary: The multimodal AI market is experiencing significant growth, particularly in AI-as-a-Service, making access more affordable for small and medium-sized businesses. Generative AI currently leads in market share due to its diverse applications, while image and video modalities are rapidly expanding. The healthcare sector is seeing a high compound annual growth rate driven by AI-driven diagnostics, with North America taking the lead in AI adoption thanks to its strong technological infrastructure...

headline: Oracle Doubles Down On Nashville World Headquarters As Cloud Hiring Hits Record High
summary: Oracle Corp (NYSE:ORCL) is trying to balance an ambitious expansion plan with investor skepticism as it builds out its AI future and reshapes its physical footprint. Oracle Pushes Nashville As A Future Growth Hub It is pushing to build Nashville into a major hub for its future, even as it faces challenges attracting enough workers.
